A quadratic residue (mod 7) is a number that can be represented as the square of an integer (mod 7). To find the quadratic residues (mod 7), we can square each integer from 0 to 6 (since we are working with mod 7) and then reduce the result modulo 7.

0^2 ≡ 0 (mod 7)
1^2 ≡ 1 (mod 7)
2^2 ≡ 4 (mod 7)
3^2 ≡ 2 (mod 7)
4^2 ≡ 2 (mod 7)
5^2 ≡ 4 (mod 7)
6^2 ≡ 1 (mod 7)

The quadratic residues (mod 7) are the distinct results obtained: {0, 1, 2, 4}.
